title: OpenAI and Taiwan's Foxconn to partner in AI hardware design and manufacturing in the US
summary: OpenAI and Taiwan electronics giant Foxconn have agreed to a partnership to design and manufacture key equipment for artificial intelligence data centers in the U.S. as part of ambitious plans to fortify American AI infrastructure.  Foxconn, which makes AI servers for Nvidia and assembles Apple products including the iPhone, will be co-designing and developing AI data center racks with OpenAI under the agreement, the companies said in separate statements on Thursday and Friday.

raw.headline: OpenAI and Taiwan's Foxconn to partner in AI hardware design and manufacturing in the US
raw.summary: OpenAI and Taiwan electronics giant Foxconn have agreed to a partnership to design and manufacture key equipment for artificial intelligence data centers in the U.S. as part of ambitious plans to fortify American AI infrastructure.  Foxconn, which makes AI servers for Nvidia and assembles Apple products including the iPhone, will be co-designing and developing AI data center racks with OpenAI under the agreement, the companies said in separate statements on Thursday and Friday.

title: Foxconn can make 1,000 AI racks a week, to increase next year, chairman says
summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -Foxconn Chairman Young Liu said on Friday the company now had the capability to manufacture ​1,000 artificial intelligence racks per week, and it expected that rate ‌to increase next year.  Liu made the comments at the contract electronics manufacturer's tech day, which ‌was attended by Foxconn's partners and clients including Nvidia and OpenAI.  Foxconn's founder, Terry Gou, also made an appearance.

raw.headline: Foxconn can make 1,000 AI racks a week, to increase next year, chairman says
raw.summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -Foxconn Chairman Young Liu said on Friday the company now had the capability to manufacture ​1,000 artificial intelligence racks per week, and it expected that rate ‌to increase next year.  Liu made the comments at the contract electronics manufacturer's tech day, which ‌was attended by Foxconn's partners and clients including Nvidia and OpenAI.  Foxconn's founder, Terry Gou, also made an appearance.

title: Foxconn to spend up to $3 billion a year on AI, chair sees China EV shakeout
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Foxconn will invest $2 billion to $3 billion a year in AI, the head of the world's largest contract electronics maker told ​Reuters.  Foxconn Chairman Young Liu also said he expects a shakeout in China's crowded electric-vehicle market "soon"‌ and that the company is talking with the Japanese government about potential investments in artificial intelligence and EVs.  "For now, AI will be the majority of ‌the investment," Liu told Reuters on a visit to Tokyo earlier this month.

raw.headline: Foxconn to spend up to $3 billion a year on AI, chair sees China EV shakeout
raw.summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Foxconn will invest $2 billion to $3 billion a year in AI, the head of the world's largest contract electronics maker told ​Reuters.  Foxconn Chairman Young Liu also said he expects a shakeout in China's crowded electric-vehicle market "soon"‌ and that the company is talking with the Japanese government about potential investments in artificial intelligence and EVs.  "For now, AI will be the majority of ‌the investment," Liu told Reuters on a visit to Tokyo earlier this month.

title: Google Launches Unauthorized Pixel-to-iPhone File Sharing With Apple’s AirDrop
summary: AirDrop, which has been around for over a decade, is built into Apple's software platforms, allowing for fast, wireless file transfers between iPhones, iPads and Macs.  Google has a similar feature for Android called Quick Share.  “When it comes to sharing moments between family and friends, what device you have shouldn’t matter — sharing should just work,” Google said in a surprise announcement on Thursday.

raw.headline: Google Launches Unauthorized Pixel-to-iPhone File Sharing With Apple’s AirDrop
raw.summary: AirDrop, which has been around for over a decade, is built into Apple's software platforms, allowing for fast, wireless file transfers between iPhones, iPads and Macs.  Google has a similar feature for Android called Quick Share.  “When it comes to sharing moments between family and friends, what device you have shouldn’t matter — sharing should just work,” Google said in a surprise announcement on Thursday.

title: Nvidia's earnings attest to its leadership in the AI race. By the numbers
summary: Nvidia reported more eye-catching numbers for its fiscal third quarter Wednesday, with net income jumping 65% and revenue increasing 62% from a year earlier.  Last month, Nvidia became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion.  The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.

raw.headline: Nvidia's earnings attest to its leadership in the AI race. By the numbers

Last month, Nvidia became the first public company to reach a market capitalization of $5 trillion.  The ravenous appetite for the Silicon Valley company's chips is the main reason that the company’s stock price has increased so rapidly since early 2023.

title: Alphabet Stock Rises, but Falls Short of Passing Microsoft in Market Cap
summary: Earlier today, Alphabet was on pace to surpass Microsoft in total market cap for the first time in seven years — but the stock later gave up some of those gains.  Alphabet stock got a boost late last week after a filing showed that Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway purchased 17.8 million shares of the company during the third quarter.  On Tuesday, Alphabet launched Gemini 3, an updated version of its own large language model — offering a chance to gain some ground in the artificial intelligence arms race.

title: Nvidia earnings clear lofty hurdle set by analysts amid fears about an AI bubble
summary: Nvidia’s sales of the computing chips powering the artificial intelligence craze surged beyond the lofty bar set by stock market analysts in a performance that may ease recent jitters about a Big Tech boom turning into a bust that topples the world’s most valuable company.  The results announced late Wednesday provided a pulse check on the frenzied spending on AI technology that has been fueling both the stock market and much of the overall economy since OpenAI released its ChatGPT three years ago.  Nvidia has been by far the biggest beneficiary of the run-up because its processors have become indispensable for building the AI factories that are needed to enable what’s supposed to be the most dramatic shift in technology since Apple released the iPhone in 2007.

raw.headline: Nvidia earnings clear lofty hurdle set by analysts amid fears about an AI bubble

Nvidia has been by far the biggest beneficiary of the run-up because its processors have become indispensable for building the AI factories that are needed to enable what’s supposed to be the most dramatic shift in technology since Apple released the iPhone in 2007.

title: Alphabet Shares Soar on ‘Rave Reviews’ for New Gemini AI Model
summary: More than 376,000 call options on Alphabet changed hands as of 11:00 a.m. in New York, above the 20-day average of about 290,000 for a full day of trading.  The Google parent on Tuesday launched the latest version of its Gemini artificial intelligence model, which was met with glowing reviews about its capabilities.  “In addition to benefits to Search engagement and monetization, Google also combines real-time web indexing with advanced model training, which we view as a key competitive advantage,” he wrote.

title: South Korea Antitrust Regulators Inspect Arm’s Office in Seoul
summary: The Korea Fair Trade Commission is conducting the unannounced inspections of Arm as part of an inquiry into its conduct, said the people, who were granted anonymity to discuss a confidential matter.  The move stems in part from a complaint by Qualcomm Inc. alleging that Arm is hurting competition by restricting access to its technology after operating an open network for more than 20 years, the people said.  Spokespeople for Arm and Qualcomm declined to comment.

raw.headline: South Korea Antitrust Regulators Inspect Arm’s Office in Seoul
raw.summary: The Korea Fair Trade Commission is conducting the unannounced inspections of Arm as part of an inquiry into its conduct, said the people, who were granted anonymity to discuss a confidential matter.  The move stems in part from a complaint by Qualcomm Inc. alleging that Arm is hurting competition by restricting access to its technology after operating an open network for more than 20 years, the people said.  Spokespeople for Arm and Qualcomm declined to comment.

title: Google unveils Gemini's next generation, aiming to turn its search engine into a 'thought partner'
summary: Google is unleashing its Gemini 3 artificial intelligence model on its dominant search engine and other popular online services in the high-stakes battle to create technology that people can trust to enlighten them and manage tedious tasks.  The next-generation model unveiled Tuesday comes nearly two years after Google took the wraps off its first iteration of the technology.  Google designed Gemini in response to a competitive threat posed by OpenAI's ChatGPT that came out in late 2022, triggering the biggest technological shift since Apple released the iPhone in 2007.
